intro: Statice psiloclada, commonly known as the sacred blue sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in coastal and saline environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in dense inflorescences, adding ornamental value to gardens. Statice psiloclada is also valued for its use in dried floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms.
